key_points: Jack Dorsey stepped down as Twitter CEO on Monday, expressing mixed emotions in an announcement email to employees.
Dorsey's departure from Twitter, happening for the second time, generated mixed reactions among users.
He co-founded Twitter in 2006 but was ousted in 2008 due to management issues and his personal habits.
In 2009, Dorsey co-founded Square, a payment service, and became its CEO, which significantly contributed to his net worth.
Dorsey returned as Twitter's CEO in 2015 while still leading Square, facing several controversies during his tenure.
Managed to survive an ouster attempt in 2020 by major shareholders due to his dual role as CEO of Twitter and Square.
Twitter, under Dorsey, blocked a controversial story about Hunter Biden ahead of the 2020 election, attracting criticism.
Dorsey admitted the decision to block the Hunter Biden story could have been handled better after it sparked controversy.
Twitter issued a lifetime ban on President Trump after the January 6 attack, citing risk of 'further incitement'.
The ban on Trump drew condemnation from Republicans; Trump is launching his own social media site.
